Contact.title: Contact us
Contact.1: We have various contacts and social medias. If you have recieved any message or request from a contact or social media that isn't listed here, then it wasn't sent by us but by a person who is attempting to impersonate us.
Contact.2: Please be respectful and do not spam any of our contacts.

About.Text:
Carboleon is a website whose purpose is to show and educate about the global and local situation of air pollution. Thanks to the hard work and commitment of the development team, this goal has not only been fulfilled, but also expanded to provide knowledge about more then just air pollution!

 Now, alongside a pollution map that's easy to read and use, the website also features a weather index.
 To help the site function, it uses various API's including 'openstreetmap', 'leaflet', 'waqi' and 'openweather'.

 The project is for a polish national competition called 'Zwolnieni z Teorii' and is funded by it's sponsor: 'e-tronix.pl', 'oko-design'.

 Check out our social media's to find more interesting content related to our cause!
About.title: Find out something about us

Home.pageTitle: Check air quality, weather and interesting places in your area
Home.title: Know what YOU BREATHE

PollutionTexts.what: Air pollution is the contamination of air by pollutants. Pollutants are particles that change the natural characteristics of the atmosphere. Here we can specifically mention inhalable particles, composed of sulfate, nitrates, ammonia, sodium chloride, black carbon, mineral dust or water. These are also called “particulate matter”(PM). PM can be of different sizes and is generally defined by their aerodynamic diameter, with PM2.5 and PM10 the most common in the regulatory framework and relevant for health.
PollutionTexts.why: Lots of people suffer from air pollution and even unknowingly, you might be one of them! A large part of the world doesn’t understand the significance of this. 7 million - that’s the amount of people who die PREMATURELY due to air pollution and its effects. It’s very likely that contaminated air is a large contributor to elderly people’s deaths as well. Just like with many cancers it's hard to find out that you are suffering from air pollution in the early stages, a part of this is because it literally causes lung cancer and other illnesses such as: strokes, heart diseases, acute and chronic respiratory diseases.  For all of the fatal effects of contaminated air, it’s hard to figure out the reason for the diseases, as well as the symptoms being unnoticeable, nonexistent or resembling that of common diseases until it’s too late…
PollutionTexts.wFight: In terms of fighting air pollution the best thing you can do is inform others of the problem, petition against removal of CO2 removing objects(e.g. Forests or other plants) and donate to charities that plant more plants. Although, fighting air pollution is only half the problem… A good idea is to fight against the rise of air pollution - getting rid of or limiting sources of air pollution around you can help everyone out significantly. An important part to remember is that whilst groups can cause change and individuals can’t, groups of individuals can! There could be a potential group of hundreds, thousands or even hundreds of thousands of individuals that will never come into existence, because everyone of them decides it’s pointless. Start the cycle and stand up for something - if more people do the same thing, that’s when change can happen. For the things you can do individually is switch out your mode of transport to one that’s more CO2 efficient like trains, buses, bikes (and if that’s not possible switching to hybrid or electric cars are a step in the right direction), switch out your home heating to gas or electric, be careful of which companies you support - just buying companies products counts as supporting them, which means buying from companies that are involved with air pollution contributes to it.
PollutionTexts.good: Well, your city/area isn’t very polluted, so there is not much you can do to protect yourself, as the isn’t much to protect yourself from (at least in terms of air pollution). You should be happy and grateful that you and/or your city/country officials and/or your coresidents of the city are keeping the area’s air pretty clean.
PollutionTexts.fine: Your city/area isn’t that polluted. You shouldn’t have to worry about air pollution too much. If you are experiencing heart or lung problems you may want to contact a doctor or buy an air purifier/start wearing a mask.
PollutionTexts.worse: Your city/area is pretty polluted. You should start considering wearing a mask and/or switching to greener ways of living and/or  buying an air purifier (if you have the money to do so) as well as considering going to a doctor. Try taking the bus or riding a bike to work/school.
PollutionTexts.bad: Your city/area’s pollution levels are higher than they should be - which is bad. Just like in the situation of worse levels of air pollution, you should consider wearing a mask and/or switching to greener ways of living and/or  buying an air purifier (if you have the money to do so). Another thing you should consider is talking to your friends, neighbors and/or family about air pollution and what they can do to protect themselves/limit it. Try regularly taking the bus or riding a bike to work/school.
PollutionTexts.vbad: Your city/area is suffering from air pollution. It is recommended you wear a mask and switch to greener ways of living. Inform others in your city/area of the problem. If you are experiencing signs of lung or heart problems/pain and/or constant headaches/migraines, you should go see a doctor. You might consider taking regular doctor’s appointments. Limit staying around areas with smoke or other forms of pollution, if that’s not possible try to refrain from inhaling it. The smog can have a very negative effect on your mental health, so try not getting depressed or developing other mental illnesses. If it’s possible, consider moving out.
PollutionTexts.ebad: Your city/area is greatly suffering from air pollution. It is very recommended to wear a mask, stay green, inform others of the terrible situation and get into contact with a doctor if you experience any of the following: extensive amounts of coughing, constant migraines, heart/chest pains, general weakness of the body/limbs. It is also recommended to have regular doctor’s appointments. The smog can have a very negative effect on your mental health, so try not getting depressed or developing other mental illnesses. You should take into great consideration moving out if possible.

PollutionTextTitles.wFight: What can you do to fight air pollution?

AssideTexts.1: You shouldn't have to worry about pollution here. Stay happy and worryfree.
AssideTexts.2: If you're experiencing heart or lung problems here, try wearing a mask. If the heart or lung problems don't stop try visiting a doctor.
AssideTexts.3: Consider wearing a mask here. Try visiting a doctor if you're experiencing heart or lung problems.
AssideTexts.4: It is recommended to wear a mask and to visit a doctor if any heart or lung problems arise. Consider taking regular doctor visits.
AssideTexts.5: Highly recommended to wear a mask here. It is recommended to visit a doctor from time to time. Consider leaving if you feel constantly unwell here.
AssideTexts.6: Masks here are a near necessity. Visiting a doctor regularly is recommended and so is leaving the area (if possible).
AssideTexts.random1: Masks here are a near neccessity. Visiting a doctor regularly is reccomended and so is leaving the area (if possible). If a city has a lot of smog and/or a very cloudy sky, you should stay away from depressing things. This type of weather can be very depressing at times.
AssideTexts.random2: Masks are a very good way to avoid the effects of air pollution. Masks don't cure lung or heart problems, neither caan they always protect, so if you are experiencing heart or lung problems consider going to a doctor
AssideTexts.random3: A good way to lower air pollution is to take the bus, train, tram, ride a bike or walk/jog to work instead of riding a car. Doing this occasionally is good, but doing it all the time makes a bigger difference.
AssideTexts.link1: Find out more about different levels of air pollution here!
AssideTexts.link2: Find out more about the problem and it's solutions here!

WeatherTips.thunderstorm with light rain: During this weather you can have a really nice time, doing basically anything!
WeatherTips.light thunderstorm: A light thunderstorm is a good time to observe lightning strikes and the sounds of nature.
WeatherTips.thunderstorm: It's a good idea to have some rest during a storm.
WeatherTips.heavy thunderstorm: Be careful! Better stay at home!
WeatherTips.ragged thunderstorm: This is the right time to have some rest.
WeatherTips.thunderstorm with light drizzle: Write to somebody that's close to you.
WeatherTips.thunderstorm with drizzle: Do you exercise? If not, then this is the perfect moment to do so.
WeatherTips.thunderstorm with heavy drizzle: Turn off all your electrical devices!
WeatherTips.light intensity drizzle: This is the perfect moment to go for a walk with an umbrella and enjoy the quiet atmosphere.
WeatherTips.heavy intensity drizzle: Better to seek shelter in buildings than to be absolutely soaked
WeatherTips.light intensity drizzle rain: This is a good time to have a cosy evening with a good book or film.
WeatherTips.heavy intensity drizzle rain: If you like dancing in the rain, then this is your moment to shine! Be careful tot not hit anyone with your umbrella though!
WeatherTips.shower rain and drizzle: When rain and drizzle meet at your path, it's best to wear some colourful galoshes and make your day colourful too!
WeatherTips.heavy shower rain and drizzle: Wanna feel like the same happiness you felt as a child? This is the perfect moment to find your inner child and jump on puddles!
WeatherTips.light rain: Wanna feel like a main character in movie or show? Take an umbrella and just go for a walk in the rain.
WeatherTips.moderate rain: This is a good moment to go for a walk and listen to music.
WeatherTips.heavy intensity rain: If rain is pouring with heavy intensity, it's best to cuddle up in a warm room.
WeatherTips.very heavy rain: you should just stay at home.
WeatherTips.extreme rain: This is not a time to go for a walk or even exit your home! Do some at-home activities, preferably something creative like painting or drawing.
WeatherTips.freezing rain: Better stay at home and delight yourself with some hot coffee or tea.
WeatherTips.light intensity shower rain: Perfect moment to take a break and take a hot shower.
WeatherTips.shower rain: If you need a bit of energy, take a walk in the rain.
WeatherTips.ragged shower rain: Better to cuddle up in a safe area and wait out the storm.
WeatherTips.light snow: This is the perfect moment to go for a walk and make a snowman or organize a snowball fight with your siblings or friends!
WeatherTips.snow: When there is a lot of snow, you can go skiing, snowboarding or sleigh-riding and feel like a master of winter sports!
WeatherTips.heavy snow: Make yourself some hot chocolate and watch your favourite film.
WeatherTips.sleet: This is a good time to do something creative, like drawing!
WeatherTips.shower sleet: This is the perfect moment to make yourself some tea and read your favourite book
WeatherTips.light rain and snow: Isn't it better to spend this time at home?
WeatherTips.rain and snow: This is a good time to do something creative.
WeatherTips.light shower snow: If there is light shower snow, then it's best to stay at home.
WeatherTips.shower snow: Best to cuddle up in a warm room and spend some quality time with your friends or family.
WeatherTips.heavy shower snow: If it's intensly snowing, then it's best to stay at home for the day.
WeatherTips.mist: Make yourself a tasty cup of coffee or tea and relax on the couch. A good idea is to read your favourite book or watch a film!
WeatherTips.smoke: If there is smoke in the air, best close your windows and doors.
WeatherTips.sand/dust whirls: This is good time to start doing some creative at-home activities.
WeatherTips.fog: Make yourself a delicious soup, sit back and relax. Just enjoy the vibe.
WeatherTips.sand: This is not a good time for a walk!
WeatherTips.dust: If you see sand or dust in the air, then it's best to cover your eyes,nose and mouth.
WeatherTips.volcanic ash: If you can see volcanic ash in the area, then it's best to stay at home and close your windows.
WeatherTips.tornado: If a tornado is approaching, then it's best to seek shelter in a secure and safe area.
WeatherTips.clear sky: Go for a walk with your friends (or alone)!
WeatherTips.Clouds: If there are only a few clouds in the sky, then it's best to go outside.
